subject: The Joy of Football
event:
First the Jets, now the Giants.  Life is meaningless and has no purpose.

The Giants and Cowboys did put on a barnburner, at least.  I thought the G-Men were going to blow them out in the first quarter -- and they might have, if Amani Toomer had only gotten his toes down on Eli's second TD bomb.  Then at the end, I thought maybe they'd somehow pull it out with a miracle finish.  But it was not to be.  

Everything in between is best forgotten.

Best game I've seen from Plax.  Eli should just have thrown to him every play.  Derrick Ward showed some good stuff too, and Amani Toomer came back bigtime from last season's injury.  The Giants O-line held up better than expected, but their D-line generated absolutely no pressure.  Strahan decided not to retire, I know, but you couldn't tell it by his presence on the field today.  Where were the sacks?  

I know most football fans love games like this, with all the scoring, but not me.  I like good defense.  I didn't see one on the field today.  Neither the Giants nor the Cowboys seems to have a defense.  Neither team could stop the other.  Both have lots of high-priced defensive stars, but that doesn't seem to translate to actual stops.

The Giants injuries are more worrisome than losing the game.  Eli Manning, Brandon Jacobs, Osi Umenyoira... that's our starting QB, starting RB, and best pass rusher.  Losing all three in the first game is no way to begin a season.

(And all my best wishes are going out to that poor TE on the Bills)

comments.article:
Rough game.

I totally agree with you about the high scoring games. It gets ridiculous at some point. (But I will admit to not minding a deep bomb to Moss or two. Call me a hypocrite.)

Where the hell did Ward come from?

The Jets.

They drafted him (late round) a few years ago. The Giants picked him up on waivers when he was cut. He's fast, but in the past he's gotten injured a lot.

Ever since Jim Fassel's last season, the Giants have been the most injured team in the league. Year after year they lead the league in players on IR. I don't know if this is just a streak of bad luck, or something amiss with their training and conditioning. Every team has a bad injury year from time to time, but five bad injury years in a row is absurd.
comments.subject: Ward

comments.article:
If it's any consolation (and it probably isn't)it was Cedric Benson (Thomas Jones' heir) who coughed up the football in the second half of the Bears/Chargers game, killing any comeback hopes. Up until that point the game was the kind of defensive gem you probably would have admired but that fumble just seemed to suck the life out of the Bears' defense.
I still don't understand how you can root for both NY teams. That would be the equivalent of rooting for the Cubs and the Sox here in the Windy City. Just wrong my friend, just wrong.
Oh well, theres a slight chill in the air, tailgaiting on the horizon and football Sundays for the next 5 months......life is good.
comments.subject: Feeling the Pain

comments.article:
(And all my best wishes are going out to that poor TE on the Bills)
Indeed. Mine too.
seconded
But the Lions won!  I'm waiting for it to rain frogs...
comments.subject: But...

comments.article: I assume you've heard already, but it's bad. Very bad. He will never play football again, he has a high chance of never walking again, and he has a not insignificant chance of actually dying from this. It's just horrible.

comments.upictitle: Xray Is As Xray Does: canes
comments.article: Yeah, bad news about that guy on the Bills. I hope the news won't be too dire. The Giants game was more engaging then the Jets, but I agree that after a point, you just want the defense to kick in and produce a few turnovers.

We thought the Giants had it in the bag that first quarter then they seemed to become their own worst enemy. How many times did they fall with no one on top of them or fumble the ball? Both teams need work. My husband was happy with the outcome, though. Silly Texas men.

The Bills TE is kind of scary.

"The Giants injuries are more worrisome than losing the game. Eli Manning, Brandon Jacobs, Osi Umenyoira... that's our starting QB, starting RB, and best pass rusher. Losing all three in the first game is no way to begin a season."

I'm sorry but Eli needs to get a little tougher this isn't flag football the hit he received didn't look like much.
comments.subject: Injuries

comments.article:
Hey, at least you don't have a messed up baseball team like we do in Baltimore. I mean, it would have been one thing to have lost to the Yankees or Red Sox 30 to 3; but the Rangers? Unforgivable. Everyone should be fired.

True, loosing all three in the first game is no way to start the season, but maybe the lack of expectations will yield pleasant surprises. You know, one of those "Who knew?" or "Where did that come from?" -type memorable seasons.

Er, what? 30-3 isn't a baseball score. That makes no sense.

But I just found the article about it. I guess I can't deny it happened. Holy cats.
If you like defensive struggles, see if you can find a tape of Eagles-Packers from yesterday. Both look like defenses to watch this year.
Personally, I hate shoot out types of games. Give me some outstanding defense any day of the week.

I missed the NYJ/NE game yesterday (here in Kentucky we were treated to a couple of snoozers like the Browns game and the Vikings/Falcons)... did I see Olberman correctly last night on the NBC game? Did the Jets "fans" really cheer for Pennington getting hurt??? If so, I'd say its time for him to skip town.

The Browns did that to Couch the season he led them to the play-offs. Yes sports fans... the worst ever number 1 overall pick (according to a recent ESPN poll of the day)is the only QB to have taken the moribund Cleveland franchise back to the playoffs since they re-entered the league. He left town (and the NFL) and the Browns have never been back to the post-season.

I hate to see Eli go down after such a promising start to the season. I'm hoping its just a bruise and not a separated shoulder. It was nice to see my boy the Hefty Lefty in there for a bit... but lets be honest, he's best served holding a clipboard and making a million dollars doing it. Speaking of old Lorenzen... what the hell was the heaviest QB in the league doing sliding down a yard short of the first down line on 4th down! He should have dropped his shoulder and taken two or three guys down with him!

All in all, a pretty decent start to the season. I can't wait to see who this year's surprise teams are going to be.
comments.subject: Chad's Injury

comments.article:
"Speaking of old Lorenzen... what the hell was the heaviest QB in the league doing sliding down a yard short of the first down line on 4th down! He should have dropped his shoulder and taken two or three guys down with him!"

So true, as an ex-UK alum myself I was shocked when I saw that. 4th and 4 and he winds up half a yard short because of the slide. I don't know if it were nerves or what but I was expecting more once he finally got his shot.
comments.subject: Re: Chad's Injury

comments.article: As a lifelong Steeler fan I can tell you its a Fool's Folly to put any faith in Plaxico. He'll burn you every time...
On the bright side, at least you aren't a University of Michigan fan...

Even with both your teams having a tough day, at least football is back.

Thankfully the Broncos managed to pull it out at literally the last second.

And I watched that play with the TE when he got hurt about a dozen times to try and understand what happened. Hopefully he is ok and has a long and healthy career.
comments.subject: Yay football

comments.article:
But I'll take it.

Lifelong Cowboys fan here, George...I'll do my best to keep from being banned from your journal!

This is the year the Boys return to their rightful place atop the division. The D last night was atrocious, but I'm confident it will get MUCH better as the season progresses. And I am officially sold on Romo.

I agree with you - I'll take a defensive struggle any day of the week (the Bears-Chargers was a fun one to watch).

So good to have football back!!!!
comments.subject: Not exactly the Doomsday Defense . . .

comments.article:
Life has plenty of purpose.

Anyway, I think the Jets and Giants actually play each other sometime this season, which means that no matter what both teams can't go winless.

Unless they tie, of course...

aww poor boy. *buys George a cheesehead hat*

The Bills TE is done. I heard something about him possibly being paralyzed on the news this morning.
When your NFL team has you down, just remind yourself "I'm glad I'm not a Wolverine." We're dying out here in Michigan!

Don't get me started. I'm ready to give back my U-M/Badgers tickets. The team I saw on the field couldn't beat St. Mary's school for blind little girls. What a way for Henne and Hart to end their careers.

While I AM thrilled about my BELOVED Cowboys victory last night, I'm also very concerned about the injuries. We saw what happened when you don't have Terence Newman in the lineup and you cut Aaron Glenn. Ack. I'll ASSUME the coaches saw enough of Glenn in camp to figure he was on his last legs, being that he is 35. But I have to think his experience might have helped some last night.

Who knows when or if Greg Ellis will come back from the Achilles injury from last year. His pass rushing was missed, though the rookie first round pick Anthony Spencer played fairly well. The real concern, though, is the loss of nose tackle Jason Ferguson to a possible season ending injury. There is really no depth behind him at tackle.

On the positive side they didn't seem to miss Terry Glenn, who may miss a portion or the entire season. And so much for the notion that Tony Romo would have a hangover from the Seattle playoff debacle last season. Though I'm sure when he does have a bad game, that is the first thing people will bring up. ;)

P.S. When did the "Fat Kid from Bedrock" start playing 2nd string QB for the Giants???
comments.subject: I feel your PAIN...

comments.article: You should watch LSU play! :D
comments.subject: If you want to see good defense

comments.article:
While watching Eli throw 4 TDs was fun, there's just something wrong with a Giant defense that gives up 45 points. It is inexcusable for a quarterback to throw for 300+yards and 4 TDs and lose.

The Giants, when successful, have always been about strong defense. I hope that they will be able to start playing like they should be capable of.

As for Everett, reports are they won't know for a few days whether he will be able to walk again. Hopefully, he will pull through and come out of this healthy. While Everett's injury was by far the worst, by the time all the games were finished, the NFL was littered with opening day injuries.

As for the Giants, to have their new top running back, their top sack leader and their quarterback to not make it through their opening game, makes me wonder what type of season this will end up being.
comments.subject: Where's the defense?

comments.article: I have to admit I hope the Giants second game isn't too good either.  I have to believe that Thomas Jones will get better as the season progresses.  The NE Defense is a tough first test.  LT only had a few rushing yards, yes a passing td and 50 receiving yds, but Michale turner hasd more rushing yds at 41 than LT.  Larry Johnson had a pitiful game against Houston.  Now if only Randy Moss will catch the injury bug, the world will be better.

A pretty awful football weekend for my football teams this weekend, too. The Hurricanes shellacked by the Sooners (lately I've been expecting this, though -- oh, how the mighty have fallen), and then the Redskins edging the Dolphins in OT (ugh).

Oh, well. There's always next week, right?
